I started with the first Halflife and I liked it. This game is very similar to the first Halflife and the story happens paralel to the story of Halflife but with another character. So here's my rating.

Gameplay: Good (same as Halflife)
Shooting experience: good (same as Halflife, dont expect same details as newer games its a 1999 game)
Story: Good (of course not so good like Halflife but was also interesting).
Graphics: good for its time. 1999 game graphics, similar to PlayStation 1 games.
HUD and user friendliness: Bad. Like Halflife, there is no mission tracking or mini map, so if you save your process and play again next day you may not remember what to do next. So listen carefully to the NPCs, they tell you what to do.

In overall if you have played Halflife and liked it, then you must play this game also. It was first supposed to be an addon but now its like a standalone addon, dont need Halflife to be installed to play it.

Like Halflife it supports Full HD resolution 1920x1080. I played on windows 10 with i5 and GTX 1060. Some minor glitches and bugs but not disturbing. I had 2 or 3 crashes without error closed to the end of the game. It was when walking to a new area, then Halflife needs 2-3 seconds to load the new area and game freezes for a short time. If you walk many times forth and back of that loading spot then game might crash. So try to avoid this.

This game is at least as much fun as the original Half-Life. That is â€“ excellent level design, original game mechanics, and when you think you have seen it all, there is something new â€“ it never gets repetitive (as some modern games do), you are never bored.

What is not so great is sound quality (very low bitrate audio â€“ it sometimes even get irritating) and poor AI of your allies, which can get annoying â€“ but hey, itâ€™s a 20 year old game.

I also had to increase the FOV in the console, which cannot be changed in the game settings, and its default value is too small for modern monitors. On the other hand, I appreciate the support of any resolution and aspect ratio (I play at 3840 Ã— 1600).

Overall, I rate the game very positively. I played it for the first time this year and I regret not knowing about it long ago.
A brilliant continuation of the Half-Life 1 story. Great characters, great music, another great game from Valve's glory days.
